alert.note: Alert for Niihau in Kauai (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 18 at 10:08AM HST until February 18 at 1:15PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Kauai in Kauai County * Until 115 PM HST. * At 1008 AM HST, radar showed bands of heavy rainfall moving over Kauai from the southeast with rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour. The water level in Hanalei River is already elevated and this new rainfall will cause the river to overflow and close Kuhio Highway within the next couple of hours. Streams and roads in east Kauai will also be impacted by runoff. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lihue, Kapaa, Kalaheo, Princeville, Kilauea, North Fork Wailua Trails, Wailua Homesteads, Hanalei, Wailua, Omao, Lawai, Wainiha, Koloa, Haena, Kokee State Park, Anahola, Poipu, Hanapepe, Moloaa and Na Pali State Park. This warning may need to be extended beyond 115 PM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
